alert.note: Alert for Dawes; North Sioux (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued February 22 at 6:36AM CST until February 23 at 6:00AM CST by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 AM MST THURSDAY... ...WIND CHILL WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 5 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO 9 AM MST THURSDAY... * WHAT...For the Winter Storm Warning, heavy snow. Additional snow accumulations of 4 to 7 inches. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph. For the Wind Chill Warning, dangerously cold wind chills expected. Wind chills as low as 40 below zero. * WHERE...Portions of panhandle Nebraska and east central and southeast Wyoming. * WHEN...For the Winter Storm Warning, until 5 AM MST Thursday. For the Wind Chill Warning, from 5 PM this afternoon to 9 AM MST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Areas of blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. The dangerously cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. Avoid outside activities if possible. When outside, make sure you wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
